definition: stingy/penny-pinching
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
as/as if/such as
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
with money, you can do anything (idiom)/money talks
every drop returns to the public good (idiom); not one penny is misused
to not even take a penny (as a bribe)
lit. as clear as water (idiom)/fig. (of officials etc) honest and incorruptible
distributing money, fighting for virtue (idiom); fig. generous in helping the needy
to use influence to get what one wants/to find a way through (esp. corrupt)/to succeed by means fair or foul
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
to allow oneself few comforts or pleasures (idiom)
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
total illiterate/unable to read the simplest characters
to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
much capital, good business (idiom); fig. good trading conditions
out of one's mind

person narrow-minded and shortsighted
